brief_description: Is Blonde, a fictionalised look at Marilyn Monroe’s life by Melbourne director Andrew Dominik, honouring or exploiting the star’s legacy? Reviews are divided, but Iconic images from Monroe’s life and work, along with the film’s recreation of many of these moments are being used on social media to both damn and praise the film, ensuring Monroe’s complex role in pop culture conitnues to resonate.
